Title: Nifty one-liner
Description:
Here is a nifty one-liner that will have GCC run the preprocessor only in one file and spit the output to vim for you to see.

errata:
* On line 24 of src.c it should read mputs("Looking for primes up to: " str(target) "\n"); there is not a puts macro hence failed expansion.

command:
cat src.c | grep -v '^#include' | gcc -E -xc - | grep -v '^#' | vim - "+setf c"
